Elements.Name: attackActive
Description: Buff Sonic's damage.

Elements.Name: configConfirm
Description: Confirms you have read the documentation.

Elements.Name: auraActive
Description: Always have Phantom Rush active

Elements.Name: flightBool
Description: To fly, jump and press L3 or jump and press RT without pressind a direction on the analog stick.  Any bugs resulting in bugged movement on the ground have been resolved.

Elements.Name: vibrationOn
Description: Enables vibration for custom actions.

Elements.Name: trailOn
Description: Enables a line style trail for both Super and Hyper Sonic.  This is active at all times unless at a standstill.

Elements.Name: burstTrailOn
Description: Enables particles that surround Sonic as an aura.  To adjust particle intensity, press and hold the Y button and use dpad up or dpad down.

Elements.Name: superSonicGPU
Description: Enables GPU particles for Super/Hyper Sonic.

Elements.Name: disableDamage
Description: Enables invincibility.  On its own, Sonic will be invincible, but he won't damage enemies on impact.

Elements.Name: transImpactDamage
Description: Toggles damage on impact when ramming into enemies.  Invinibility should be enabled for this to work correctly.

Elements.Name: hyperFlash
Description: Instakill most enemies within a nearby radius.  Hold a parry and press Y to use.

Elements.Name: hyperFlashDamage
Description: Enables damage for the Hyper Flash move while used as a double jump.  Perfect who those who like the move, but don't want to kill enemies on accident.  Using a parry and pressing Y will still deal damage.

Elements.Name: hyperFlashWhiteOut
Description: Enables the white screen flash effect for the Hyper Flash.  Can cause softlocks in menus.  In most cases, using the button combination for a hyper flash can resolve this.

Elements.Name: flashFade
Description: Makes the Hyper Flash fade out.  'Hyper Flash Screen Flash' must be enabled for this to function.

Elements.Name: hyperFlashExplosion
Description: Toggles additional effects during the Hyper Flash.

Elements.Name: hyperStomp
Description: Deals massive damage to most enemies within a sizeable radius.

Elements.Name: hyperStompExtendDamage
Description: Extends the damage range for the Super/Hyper Stomp.

Elements.Name: hyperSpinDash
Description: Powers up the spin dash with a wider hitbox radius and a spark trail.

Elements.Name: hyperStompCameraShake
Description: Toggles screen shake during a Hyper Stomp.

Elements.Name: hyperFlashCameraShake
Description: Toggles screen shake during a Hyper Flash.

Elements.Name: hyperSpinBoostCamera
Description: Makes the camera shake during a Hyper Spin Boost.  Do not use if you're sensitive to camera movement.

Elements.Name: hyperSpinBoostChargeCamera
Description: Makes the camera shake when charging a Hyper Spin Boost.  Do not use if you're sensitive to camera movement.

Elements.Name: chaosMeteor
Description: An original move.  While Hyper Sonic or Super Sonic 2 is active, press the left and right bumpers, then press and hold X/Square button to activate Chaos Meteor. During this time, your hitbox radius will slightly increase.  Letting go of X/Square will release a Chaos Blast, dealing a high amount of damage to anything within a small radius. Alternatively, press both triggers and hold the X/Square button to activate Chaos Meteor, then release X/Square to use Chaos Blast.

Elements.Name: hyperStandingBurst
Description: While stationary as open world Hyper Sonic, press and hold the boost button, then move the analog stick in any direction to boost, leaving behind an explosion.  Deals miniscule damage to nearby enemies.

Elements.Name: hyperLock
Elements.DisplayName: Force Hyper Sonic abilities on all characters
Description: EXPERIMENTAL: Intended to enable Hyper Sonic's abilities on Sonic's friends.  May not work as intended.
Turns on custom physics.  The physics used will be dependent on which open zone model you choose.
Turns off custom physics.

Enables realtime cutscenes.  Only the cutscenes before and during the final boss (except for the final cutscene) are currently supported.  Support for additional cutscenes will be added over time, as testing is needed throughout various points in the game.
Turns off realtime cutscenes.
This sets you to base Sonic.  It also disables custom physics, regardless of what is selected above.
